When the yaksha Torch-Mouth said this, he suddenly disappeared.

Having heard these words, his mind was extremely distressed.
It was as if he was intoxicated and fainted,

May the Lord of the Gods be my savior and deliver me from the suffering of death.

He will be born in a cesspool as a female ghost with a pig's face, always eating feces and urine.
In that cesspool, there will be hundreds of thousands of koá¹­is of maggots.
They will always nibble on the female ghost's body at three times [a day].

By the power of karma, their flesh and body gradually recover and become full. They receive such a body for seven years.
Then, after death, they are reborn as turtles in a wilderness.
In that wilderness, they do not hear the name of water, let alone water.
There are no trees or shade.
They always stay in the sun, their bodies burning. They only eat hot soil.
They are pecked by crows, their bodies falling apart piece by piece.
By the power of karma, their bodies grow back and are then torn apart again.
They experience such suffering for five years, then die.
They are then reborn as fish in that city, their bodies vast.

There are also various other animals that come to eat them.
By the power of karma, they obtain water.
